snippet: As of Thursday, the city had begun work on 132 homes and had issued 397 checks worth a total of more than $6.37 million through its Build It Back program, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio says the city is on track to meet modest initial goals set in April for reimbursing homeowners and repairing homes damaged by Hurricane Sandy; city has begun work on 132 homes and issued 397 checks worth total of more than $6.37 million.
lead_paragraph: As of Thursday, the city had begun work on 132 homes and had issued 397 checks worth a total of more than $6.37 million through its Build It Back program, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

headline.main: De Blasio Cites Progress in Push to Fix Homes Damaged by Hurricane Sandy
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Cites Progress in Push to Fix Storm-Damaged Homes
